channel.title: Tomato on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Tomato on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Chickpea, Potato and Tomato Stew: six recipes to mix and match from
item.description: Haven't cooked any of these yet, but there's some recipes to work through: Ricki Heller: Chickpea, Potato and Tomato Stew. Uses tahini to enrich the sauce. Fit Pregnancy: Chickpea, Potato and Tomato Stew with Chard . With chard, paprika, parsley. The First Mess: moroccan-style vegetable + chickpea stew . Sweet potatoes instead of potatoes, and a cinnamon+coriander+cumin spice. The Picky Eater: Indian Chickpea and Potato Stew. Curry is the flavor here, and cilantro replaces parsley.

item.title: Scrambled eggs with slow roasted tomatoes (炒鸡蛋西红柿)
item.description: I did the slow roasting during high tomato season, and there are a few quarts of them in the freezer. Wondering which recipes would show up for a search for "recipe egg tomato" on Twitter, I ended up much to my surprise on a Beijing travel web site, which had a recipe for Fried Egg and Tomato – Chǎo Jīdàn Xīhóngshì – 炒鸡蛋西红柿. Egg and tomato might sound like an odd combination, but this is a really common Chinese dish which can be found on the menu at every cheap and cheerful Chinese eatery in Beijing.
